resources.name: Jar of Honey
resources.text: Date Farmer’s quality goods. Illegal owners may give this to the owner but may not trade it or use it towards Communal Responsibilities or events; spending on Family Responsibilities or discarding is a transgression

resources.name: Pitcher of Wine
resources.text: Vintner’s quality goods. Illegal owners may give this to the owner but may not trade it or use it towards Communal Responsibilities or events; spending on Family Responsibilities or discarding is a transgression.

resources.name: Jar of Milk

events.name: Money in the River
events.text:
You find money floating in the river.
Treat this card as {value}.

events.name: Animal Lost
events.text: {player_affected} puts a random one underneath this card. That animal is no longer in their hand, but may be found during Festival
events.player_affected: First player in turn order with any legally owned animals

events.name: Abandoned Donkey
events.text: You see a stranger leave a donkey by the side of the road, neglecting to tie it down. You may ignore this card (nothing happens), keep it (transgression, treat this card as an animal of value {value} ), or return it (above and beyond the law and go straight to discard phase)

events.name: Animal Runs Away
events.text:
You see a neighbor’s animal run away. 
{player_affected} You may ignore it (owner discards the animal to your transgression pile) OR return it (go straight to discard phase).
events.player_affected: The next player in turn order with any animals chooses a random one.

events.name: Found an Object
events.text: {player_affected} draws a Lost Resource card. It is not legally theirs, but counts as a card in their hand.
events.player_affected: First player in turn order with fewer than 3 Resources

events.name: Object Lost
events.text: {player_affected} puts a random legally owned Resource underneath this card. It is no longer in their hand, but may be found during a Festival.
events.player_affected: Player with the most Family Responsibilities completed

events.name: Abandoned Cow
events.text: You see a stranger leave a cow by the side of the road, neglecting to tie it down. You may ignore this card (nothing happens), keep it (transgression, treat this card as an animal of value {value}), or return it (above and beyond the law and go straight to discard phase)

events.name: Abandoned Sheep
events.text: You see a stranger leave a sheep by the side of the road, neglecting to tie it down. You may ignore this card (nothing happens), keep it (transgression, treat this card as an animal of value {value}), or return it (above and beyond the law and go straight to discard phase)

events.name: Khamsin (Windstorm)
events.text:
{player_affected} must lose a total of at least {col_cost} collectively.
Current cost: {col_cost}
For every paid by {bonus_trigger} you, gain +{bonus} towards that total.
If the total cannot be paid, the game ends in destitution.

events.name: Festival (Sukkot)
events.text: Perform a Festival Phase now. (All players, in turn order: declare lost/found objects, open market, draw new Responsibilities). Then draw another Event.

events.name: Found Object in the River
events.text:
You find an object floating in the river.
Draw a Lost Resource. Keep as the legal owner, OR discard it (above and beyond the law).

events.name: Monsoon
Money-Purse in River
events.text:
You find a marked money-purse in the river. 
Choose one: keep it (keep this card, counts as {value}) OR return it (discard this, going above and beyond the law).

events.name: Breeding
events.text: {player_affected} keeps this card. It counts as an animal worth {value}
events.player_affected: First player in turn order with any legally owned animals

events.name: Scholarly
events.text: {player_affected} It can be used as a resource worth 3
events.player_affected: Player with the fewest Family Responsibilities keeps this card.

events.name: Money in the Dust
events.text:
You see a neighbor drop money in the sand at the market. 
{player_affected} chooses a random one. You may look at it and return it (above and beyond the law) or keep it.
events.player_affected: The next player in turn order with any dinarim cards

events.name: Flood
events.text:
{player_affected} must lose a total of at least {col_cost} collectively.
Current cost: {col_cost}
For every {bonus_trigger} paid by you, gain +1 towards that total.
If the total cannot be paid, the game ends in destitution.

events.name: Locusts
events.text:
Objective: Donate {col_cost}.
Failure: {player_affected} discard all Resources in their hands.

events.name: Plague
events.text:
Objective: Donate {col_cost}.
Failure: {player_affected} must collectively discard a total of 8 Resource cards. If players cannot do this (or refuse to), the game ends in destitution.

events.name: Festival(Shavuot)
events.text: Perform a Festival Phase now. ({player_affected}, in turn order: declare lost/found objects, open market, draw new Responsibilities). Then draw another Event.

events.name: Bumper Crop
events.text:
You have an extra yield this season. 
{player_affected} draws a Resource.
events.player_affected: Player with the fewest completed Family Responsibilities

events.name: Honey Jar Cracks
events.text: Find the first player in turn order who owns at least one Jar of Honey. The next player after them who legally owns a Empty Vessel  chooses: ignore (Jar of Honey is discarded in their transgression pile), negotiate (Empty Vessel is lost in exchange for negotiated compensation), or help for free (Empty Vessel is lost, above and beyond the law).

events.name: Honey Jar cracks
events.text: Find the first player in turn order who owns at least one Jar of Honey. The next player after them who legally owns a Pitcher of Wine chooses: ignore (Jar of Honey is discarded in their transgression pile), negotiate (Pitcher of Wine is lost in exchange for negotiated compensation), or help for free (Pitcher of Wine is lost, above and beyond the law).

events.name: Festival (Pesach)
events.text: Perform a Festival Phase now. ({player_affected}, in turn order: declare lost/found objects, open market, draw new Responsibilities). Then draw another Event.

events.name: Fire
events.text:
{player_affected} must lose a total of at least {col_cost} collectively.
Current cost: {col_cost}
For every {bonus_trigger} paid by you, gain +1 towards that total.
If the total cannot be paid, the game ends in destitution.

events.name: Celebrate Birth
events.text:
You celebrate the birth of a new child. 
Keep this card. Treat it as {value}

communal_responsibilities.name: Train a Teacher
communal_responsibilities.text:
Collectively train a teacher. Pay 14, -{bonus} for each {bonus_from} completed.
Current cost: {cost}

communal_responsibilities.name: Train a Scribe
communal_responsibilities.text:
Collectively train a scribe. Pay 14, -{bonus} for each {bonus_from} completed.
Current cost: {cost}

communal_responsibilities.name: Train a Judge
communal_responsibilities.text:
Collectively train a judge. Pay 12, -{bonus} for each {bonus_from} completed.
Current cost: {cost}

communal_responsibilities.name: Build a Synagogue
communal_responsibilities.text:
Collectively build a Synagogue in your community. Pay 12, -{bonus} for each {bonus_from} completed.
Current cost: {cost}

communal_responsibilities.name: Charity Collector
communal_responsibilities.text:
Collectively donate towards charity. Pay 12, -{bonus} for each {bonus_from} completed.
Current cost: {cost}

communal_responsibilities.name: Clean Water
communal_responsibilities.text:
Collectively get access to clean water. Pay 8, -{bonus} for each {bonus_from} completed.
Current cost: {cost}

communal_responsibilities.name: Train a Butcher
communal_responsibilities.text:
Collectively train a butcher. Pay 8, -{bonus} for each {bonus_from} completed.
Current cost: {cost}

communal_responsibilities.name: Train a Doctor
communal_responsibilities.text:
Collectively train a doctor. Pay 10, -{bonus} for each {bonus_from} completed. {additional_text} {additional_bonus}.
Current cost: {cost}
communal_responsibilities.additional_text: If Plague Event is drawn after this is complete, its donation cost is

communal_responsibilities.name: Build a Bathhouse
communal_responsibilities.text:
Collectively build a community bathhouse. Pay 10, -{bonus} for each {bonus_from} completed. {additional_text} {additional_bonus}.
Current cost: {cost}
communal_responsibilities.additional_text: If Monsoon Event is drawn after this is complete, its donation cost is

communal_responsibilities.name: Build a Bathroom
communal_responsibilities.text:
Collectively build a public bathroom. Pay 10, -{bonus} for each {bonus_from} completed. {additional_text} {additional_bonus}.
Current cost: {cost}
communal_responsibilities.additional_text: If Locust Event is drawn after this is complete, its donation cost is

family_responsibilities.name: Teach a Trade
family_responsibilities.bonus_to: Resources that list you as the owner are worth +1.

family_responsibilities.name: Teach the Law
family_responsibilities.bonus_to: You may contribute to two Family and/or Communal Responsibilities on your turn.

family_responsibilities.name: Teach to Swim
family_responsibilities.bonus_to: For any Disaster Events you draw, treat it as if 4 have already been donated

family_responsibilities.name: Celebrate Marriage
family_responsibilities.bonus_to: At the start of each Festival, draw a random card from the Resource discard pile.

family_responsibilities.name: Redemption of Firstborn
family_responsibilities.bonus_to: Your hand size limit is now +1.

roles.name: VINTNER
roles.startingResources: Starting resources: 1 Dinar; Jar of Honey
roles.text: Once on your turn, you may put one of your legally owned Resources on the bottom of the Resource deck and draw another Resource card.

roles.name: VINTNER
roles.startingResources: Starting resources: 1 Dinar; Jar of Honey
roles.text: Once on your turn, you may put one of your legally owned Resources on the bottom of the Resource deck and draw another Resource card.

roles.name: POTTER
roles.text: When you use legally owned Empty Vessels, Jars of Milk, Vessels of Wine, or Jars of Honey on Responsibilities, Crises, or Disasters, they are worth +1 value (for Communal Responsibilities and Crises, turn the cards sideways as a reminder).

roles.name: POTTER
roles.text: When you use legally owned Empty Vessels, Jars of Milk, Vessels of Wine, or Jars of Honey on Responsibilities, Crises, or Disasters, they are worth +1 value (for Communal Responsibilities and Crises, turn the cards sideways as a reminder).

roles.name: COWHERD
roles.text: Once per game, draw two extra cards from the Resource Deck. This may be done at any time on your turn.

roles.name: COWHERD
roles.text: Once per game, draw two extra cards from the Resource Deck. This may be done at any time on your turn.

roles.name: SHEPHERD
roles.startingResources: Starting Resources: 1 Dinar, Jar of Milk
roles.text: Once per game, when a Resource is played or discarded by any player (including you), you may take one such card into your hand. This does not alter ownership of the card; treat it as if the card had just been drawn.

roles.name: SHEPHERD
roles.startingResources: Starting Resources: 1 Dinar, Jar of Milk
roles.text: Once per game, when a Resource is played or discarded by any player (including you), you may take one such card into your hand. This does not alter ownership of the card; treat it as if the card had just been drawn.

roles.name: DATE FARMER
roles.startingResources: Starting Resources: 1 Dinar, Vessel of Wine
roles.text: When drawing Heshbon cards to check for lost and found objects during Festival, draw two cards instead of one and uses whichever card you prefer.

roles.name: DATE FARMER
roles.startingResources: Starting Resources: 1 Dinar, Vessel of Wine
roles.text: When drawing Heshbon cards to check for lost and found objects during Festival, draw two cards instead of one and uses whichever card you prefer.
